Hi,

Derek wrote:
 Thanks for the link, Colin.  I was a little disappointed to discover
 that their format was restricted to board state evaluations at a 1-ply

Hi,

Derek wrote:
>Thanks for the link, Colin.  I was a little disappointed to discover
>that their format was restricted to board state evaluations at a 1-ply
>depth search.

         They are planning more complex entries, but they haven't 
finalized he format for them yet.

>   Why not just recieve the board state and return a
>suggested move?

         I guess the problem with this is what language would you be 
using then they tried to pass you the data.

         I did try to start a project called REACTS, quite a while 
ago now, where the idea was to provide a system to abstract the 
communication problem away from the user and allow miscellaneous 
program formats to enter the same competition, but I didn't get 
enough support so I shelved it.

         Ian



In fifteen minutes, everybody will be in the future.
